required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Response to Bivalent and Tetravalent Human Papillomavirus Vaccine in HIV Infected Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Immune Response to Bivalent and Tetravalent Human Papillomavirus Vaccine in HIV Infected Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze and compare the immunogenicity of Bivalent and Tetravalent vaccines against Human Papillomavirus in HIV-infected adult persons.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titres of serum HPV-16 and HPV-18 antibody titers on measured by Pseudovirion-Based Neutralization Assay (PBNA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titres of serum HPV-31, HPV-33, HPV-45, HPV-52 and HPV-58 antibody measured by Pseudovirion-Based Neutralization Assay (PBNA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Avidity of HPV-16 and -18 serum antibodies measured by ELISA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequencies of HPV-16 and HPV-18 T-cells measured by flow cytometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequencies of HPV-16 and -18 specific B-cells measured by B-cell ELISPOT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: B-cell profile measured by Flow cytometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Secretion of pro- and antiinflammatory cytokines from PBMC's stimulated with innate stimuli measured by Luminex or Elisa
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Type-specific HPV-DNA from cervical and genital swab material
CD4 cell count and HIV viral load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0, Day 45, Day 180, Day 210 and Day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and intensity of solicited local symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a vaccination diary with regards to local symptoms. Number and intensity of local symptoms will be listed and summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence, intensity and relationship to vaccination of solicited general symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a vaccination diary with regards to general symptoms. Number and intensity of generalized symptoms will be listed and summarized in a form.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the active phase of the study (up to Day 210)

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of clinically relevant abnormalities in hematological and biochemical parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the active phase of the study (up to Day 210)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical significant changes in hemoglobin, ALAT, basic phosphatase and creatinine compared to baseline values will be listed and summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titres of HPV-16 and HPV-18 and total Immunoglobulin G (IgG) titers in cervicovaginal secretion (CVS) from female participants
Geometric mean titres of serum HPV-6 and HPV-11 antibody measured by a competitive Luminex immunoassay (cLIA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: To be measured at day 0, day 45, day 180, day 210 and day 365

secondary_outcome.measure: % of participants seropositive for anti-HPV-6, -11 -18, -31, -33, -45, -52 and -58
secondary_outcome.description: % of participants seropositive for anti-HPV-6, -11 as measured by a competitive Luminex immunoassay (cLIA) and % of participants seropositive for anti-HPV-18, -31, -33, -45, -52 and -58 antibodies as measured by either Pseudovirion-Based Neutralization Assay (PBNA)

intervention.description: Subjects will receive three doses of the study vaccine administered intramuscularly according to a Day 0, Week 6, and Month 6 vaccination schedule.
Subjects will receive three doses of the study vaccine administered intramuscularly according to a Day 0, Week 6, and Month 6 vaccination schedule.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV positive subjects.
- Age above 18 at the time of the first vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
- Subjects whom the investigator believes can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- If currently on antiretroviral therapy (ART), subjects must be compliant to triple therapy (highly active ART) and have undetectable viral load for a period of six months prior to study entry.
- Female subjects of non-childbearing potential may be enrolled in the study.
- Female subjects of childbearing potential may be enrolled in the study, if the subject has a negative pregnancy test at screening and on the day of vaccination, and has agreed to continue adequate contraception during the entire treatment period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccination against HPV, or planned administration of any HPV vaccine other than that foreseen by the study protocol during the study period (Day 0 to Month 12).
- Pregnant or breastfeeding female.
- Previous enrollment in the study.
- Subjects whom the investigator believes cannot and/or will not comply with the requirements of the protocol (i.e. because of abuse of drugs or alcohol, dementia or given medical, psychiatric, social or work related conditions).
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressive drugs
- Cancer or autoimmune disease
- Previous allergic reaction to vaccination
- Known allergy towards on or more components of either of the test drugs.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Infectious Diseases, Aarhus University Hospital, Denmark
